name: BrainAware
0:
”Alexa open Brain Aware.”
”Alexa ask Brain Aware to let me assess my cognition abilities.”
”Alexa ask Brain Aware to compare my first and last assessments.”
skdetail:
Rated: Guidance Suggested. This skill contains: dynamic content.
Invocation Name: brain aware
des:
Brain Aware enables you or anyone in your household to track their own perceptions of your thinking abilities in six different areas or domains over the previous seven days. That feature requires you to first register with a first name before assessing your cognition abilities. After that, you can rate yourself in the following areas on a scale of 1 to 5:
1. Sharpness
2. Memory
3. Speed
4. Keeping track of what you are doing despite interruptions
5. Concentration, and
6. Clarity

You are given an opportunity to log your scores so you can compare them in the future. Those comparisons can be between your first and most recent scores or between your most recent and previous scores. Brain Aware does not give medical advice. If you have concerns about your scores or the trend of them, you should discuss them with your physician.

An added feature is the ability to schedule reminders for you to check your scores on a periodic basis.

Brain Aware uses the PROMIS Item Bank v2.0 – Cognitive Function – Abilities Subset to enable the user to ask themselves six questions about their perceptions of their thinking abilities. Permission to use this copyrighted tool has been given to RAK from the Department of Medical Social Sciences at Northwestern University Feinberg School of Medicine.
